properties.areaDesc: Eastern Mojave Desert, Including the Mojave National Preserve; Morongo Basin; Western Mojave Desert
properties.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 2 at 3:30PM PST until February 3 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Las Vegas NV
properties.description:
* WHAT...Southwest to west winds of 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to
70 mph will persist through the overnight hours.

* WHERE...The Mojave Desert and Morongo Basin including Barstow,
Daggett, Baker, Mountain Pass, Morongo Valley, Twentynine
Palms, and Yucca Valley.

* WHEN...Until 6 PM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Very dangerous driving conditions for travelers
along Interstate 15 especially through Mountain Pass and
Barstow due to strong winds and possible blowing dust. High
profile vehicles are especially vulnerable to being blown over
due to extreme winds impacting this highway and other area
roadways. Additionally, multiple and possibly long duration
power outages are expected area-wide. Downed trees and power
poles are possible area-wide as well. Securing any loose items
such as trash cans, outdoor plants, sports equipment, or
trampolines, is highly recommended.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest speeds are expected late this
evening evening and overnight. Speeds will decrease through the
morning hours on Monday but widespread gusts over 40 mph will
likely continue through Monday.
properties.instruction:
People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around
trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of
your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use extreme
caution if you must drive, especially if you are operating a semi-
truck or panel truck with a wide trailer.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST MONDAY
